intro: Malvastrum rhizanthum, commonly known as the yellow marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces fluffy, seed-filled pods that disperse its seeds by wind. Malvastrum rhizanthum thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
